reviews.text: THis place was below aveage the last few years. They have done a GREAT JOB ON THE RENOVATION they are still waiting for the LCD tv's but everything else is great. more itmes on the actual buffet part of breakfast would be nice, they also have some lady that acts like breakfast security I am sure she is supposed to be a host of some type but is more concerned with your name and room number
reviews.title: this hotel has had an AMAZING renovation

reviews.text: This is nice hotel, BUT note the following: They are doing construction and although the noise is minimized, the afternoons may be filled by saws and other noises, and I would particularly avoid the floor above the ones being worked on, 2) I asked for a quiet room and got one, except that a dumpster is located directly east of the hotel and several mornings I was awakened before 6 a.m. by the beeping sounds of trucks backing up.
reviews.title: Good hotel, lousy service

likes.disliked: — Long lines at breakfast, lousy evening snacks, distance from downtown

reviews.text: FINALLY: I believe that I left my video camera charger in the room, so I call FOUR times to housekeeping and NEVER received a call back; finally I called a manager on duty who assured me he would check and get back with me, but I STILL got no call or message again that day. I am totally frustrated that my charger may be there but no one has yet to even return a call to determine if it was found. Otherwise the hotel was fine.
reviews.title: Good location, Poor Service

reviews.text: Stayed at the Embassy Suites Memphis on March 20th for 2 nights with my family. The hotel is in a great area, with lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Look out for renovations............

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is going through some renovations, which did not impede our stay at all. The room was lovely, clean, and all items in working order.
reviews.title: A great value

reviews.text: I stayed just for 1 night, in August 2008, traveling with friends, from East US to West. Average hotel, Clean, noisy from very early in the morning. Good breakfast, comparing other US hotels of the same level. Bad breakfast comparing with the european standarts. The worst of all, it was. that asking the staff to prepare the sofa bed for the night (we were 3 and the bed was'nt ready) they told us that linen can be found in the suite's closet. WE HAD TO MAKE OUR BED, AS THEY TOLD US!!
reviews.title: Bad Service

likes.disliked: — Noisy, small pool, above average breakfast, expensive

reviews.text: SO, DO NOT STAY THERE IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO MAKE YOUR BED BY YOUR SELF!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Darn Fly infestation in the Atrium - very bothersome and distracting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Business Trip to Memphis I always try to book Hilton properties for the rich Hilton Honors program. Check in at this Embassy Suites was very smooth greeted warmly by the staff. Parking is free, but gets tight later in the evening. Rooms are typical of this chain, 2 room suites surrounding a central atrium courtyard. Some noice from outside, but could easily drown it out. The manager's reception has free cocktails and light finger food. The bartender was fun - each night he had a different pair of Mardi Gras style glasses on - he really worked the tip angle, but hey he was working hard and pouring good ones. The room is clean, beds are to die for very comfortable. Everyone I met at this hotel
reviews.title: Just okay

reviews.text: always had a smile and a pleasant word. The gym is wonderful I like these new Precor gyms - new cardio equipment, dumbbells up to 50lbs and benchs to get a decent work out in. The made to order breakfast was not really made to order i.e. no Omlette station like I'm used to finding, but they plenty of other food
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Darn Fly infestation in the Atrium - very bothersome and distracting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and for once they had the coke dispensers on!!!!
reviews.title: We always stay at Embassys....

likes.liked: — Our room was on the first floor

reviews.text: I was assigned to Memphis in November and have to travel there every month. I've stayed at the Hilton and at the Doubletree on Sanderlin once each. All of the other visits I have stayed at the Embassy Suites on Shady Grove. The rooms are very comfortable with modern decor. Each room in the suite has a flat screen TV with HD. The beds are very comfortable. The work out facility has high quality equipment. I also like to walk arond the neighborhood for exercise. The ducks in the lobby crack me up especially when they walk through the breakfast area. It's a nice touch that brings a smile to my face every time. Going forward I will be sure to book my Memphis when I can secure a reservation at the Embassy Suites. It's a great hotel and convenient to most of my clients in the Memphis area.
reviews.title: Always Stay At the Embassy Suites

reviews.text: My husband and I visited this hotel on a recent business trip. It was FANTASTIC! Very nice, clean, quiet and friendly. We missed the "social hour", but attended breakfast in the morning and was absolutely blown away...ANYTHING you wanted was there and ALL THE STAFF had a pleasant greeting and a smile. I was sooooooooooo amazed that I went and found a manager to compliment the staff. It was so refreshing. Lovely hotel. Can't wait to return!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful staff...All had smiles!

reviews.text: The five of use stayed at this Embassy for a birthday weekend with the mother-in-law who is an Elvis fan. As with all Embassy Suites, the breakfast & happy hour was great & adds to the value of the experience. The people who cleaned up after & during breakfast were all very charming & great people with which to converse. Our room contained flat-screen televisions & appeared overall up-to-date. We stayed out of the pool/spa area... at any one time there were 10-15 kids in the pool. The fitness center was well stocked with Precor equipment & free weights. The small business center was never really occupied & made for getting on the internet a breeze. (I did have my laptop... but refuse to pay for the Wi-Fi)
reviews.title: We were satisfied

reviews.text: My one complaint: I wish that hotel management would have located the obvious birthday party group further away from "regular" guests. It was apparent that the hotel room adjacent to ours was rented for the weekend for (I am sure) a very nice 9-10 year old boy & about 8 of his friends.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel experience

reviews.text: Overall we were very satisfied. The hotel was located in a good area, about 15-20 minutes from the airport.
reviews.title: awesome hotel!!!

reviews.text: Booked into the Embassy for one night as we wanted to visit Graceland. Arrived at the hotel prior to the 3pm check in time and the room was ready. Requested an extra late check out as our flight was only leaving at 6pm and received it. Very much appreciated!
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Embassy

reviews.text: The two room suite is clean with more than enough space for families with 2 children. Don't expect to all use the bathroom shampoo, conditioner & body lotion as they are the smallest sizes I've seen. The beds are comfy as is the sleeper sofa. You do have to make it up yourself but everything is supplied in the closet. Tv's are flat screen with more than enough channels. We did not partake of the manager reception or breakfast. Did not have any parking problems. Enjoyed our visit to Graceland. Thought the tour was done in a gracious respectful manner. I must say that the Memphis airport has the friendliest employees I've ever experienced.
reviews.title: Great Family Experience

likes.liked: — The spacious rooms and made to order breakfast

reviews.text: We stayed at the Embassy with our three kids the week of Christmas. The rooms were clean and large. With a 14,12 and 10 year old, we need the room. The front room with a sleeper sofa, desk, chair & TV was perfect for my husband. The girls and I had our own room with 2 beds, a sink and TV. It was nice that there was a door that closed between the two rooms. There also was a hotel fridge, microwave and another sink right by the bathroom.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: The made to order breakfast in the morning was delicious and filling. The manager's reception at night had hot appetizers, drinks & munchies. We made a meal out of it one night and saved some money on restaurants.
reviews.title: Gift Shop is Irreronsible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel wasn't very busy, due to most folks being with family over Christmas, but it still had adequate staff, who were very courteous. We loved having the place to ourselves and would go back in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Embassy
